name: Dinner Tonight: English Country Cheddar Soup
description: English cheddar soup is actually remarkably light. It relies on a very sharp, very good cheddar cheese, which means you don't need much of it. Onions and leeks provide the base, and just a touch of cream is the final flourish.
recipeIngredient: 2 carrots, peeled and cut into julienne strips
2 cups good quality grated sharp cheddar cheese

recipeInstructions.text: In heavy-bottomed pot, heat chicken fat or butter until melted, then add onion and leek. Sweat until tender, then sprinkle in flour and stir well to incorporate. Cook for 3-4 minutes, then whisk in broth and wine until smooth. Add carrots, then bring to a boil and simmer 15-20 minutes, until soup thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in cheddar, Worcestershire, cayenne, and salt. Stir in cream. Heat until just hot, taking care not to boil, which could break the soup. Serve with chives for garnish.
